verses.verse: The words <WH1697> of the Preacher, <WH6953> the son <WH1121> of David, <WH1732> king <WH4428> in Jerusalem. <WH3389>
Vanity <WH1892> of vanities, <WH1892> said <WH559> the Preacher, <WH6953> vanity <WH1892> of vanities; <WH1892> all <WH3605> is vanity. <WH1892>
What <WH4100> profit <WH3504> has a man <WH120> of all <WH3605> his labor <WH5999> which he takes <WH5998> under <WH8478> the sun? <WH8121>
One generation <WH1755> passes <WH1980> away, and another generation <WH1755> comes: but the earth <WH776> stays <WH5975> for ever. <WH5769>
The sun <WH8121> also rises, <WH2224> and the sun <WH8121> goes <WH935> down, and hastens <WH7602> to his place <WH4725> where <WH8033> he arose. <WH2224>

The wind <WH7307> goes <WH1980> toward <WH413> the south, <WH1864> and turns <WH5437> about to the north; <WH6828> it whirls <WH1980> about continually, and the wind <WH7307> returns <WH7725> again <WH7725> according <WH5921> to his circuits. <WH5439>

All <WH3605> the rivers <WH5158> run <WH1980> into <WH413> the sea; <WH3220> yet the sea <WH3220> is not full; <WH4392> to the place <WH4725> from where the rivers <WH5158> come, <WH1980> thither <WH8033> they return <WH7725> again. <WH7725>

All <WH3605> things <WH1697> are full of labor; <WH3023> man <WH376> cannot <WH3808> <WH3201> utter <WH1696> it: the eye <WH5869> is not satisfied <WH7646> with seeing, <WH7200> nor <WH3808> the ear <WH241> filled <WH4390> with hearing. <WH8085>

The thing that has been, <WH1961> it is that which shall be; and that which is done <WH6213> is that which shall be done: <WH6213> and there is no <WH369> new <WH2319> thing under <WH8478> the sun. <WH8121>

Is there any thing <WH1697> whereof it may be said, <WH559> See, <WH7200> this <WH2088> is new? <WH2319> it has been <WH1961> already <WH3528> of old <WH5769> time, which <WH834> was before <WH6440> us.

There is no <WH369> remembrance <WH2146> of former <WH7223> things; neither <WH3808> shall there be any remembrance <WH2146> of things that are to come <WH314> with those that shall come <WH1961> after. <WH314>
I the Preacher <WH6953> was king <WH4428> over <WH5921> Israel <WH3478> in Jerusalem. <WH3389>

And I gave <WH5414> my heart <WH3820> to seek <WH1875> and search <WH8446> out by wisdom <WH2451> concerning <WH5921> all <WH3605> things that are done <WH6213> under <WH8478> heaven: <WH8064> this <WH1931> sore <WH7451> travail <WH6045> has God <WH430> given <WH5414> to the sons <WH1121> of man <WH120> to be exercised <WH6031> therewith.

I have seen <WH7200> all <WH3605> the works <WH4639> that are done <WH6213> under <WH8478> the sun; <WH8121> and, behold, <WH2009> all <WH3605> is vanity <WH1892> and vexation <WH7469> of spirit. <WH7307>
That which is crooked <WH5791> cannot <WH3808> <WH3201> be made straight: <WH8626> and that which is wanting <WH2642> cannot <WH3808> <WH3201> be numbered. <WH4487>

I communed <WH1696> with my own heart, <WH3820> saying, <WH559> See, <WH2009> I am come to great <WH1431> estate, and have gotten <WH3254> more wisdom <WH2451> than <WH5921> all <WH3605> they that have been <WH1961> before <WH6440> me in Jerusalem: <WH3389> yes, my heart <WH3820> had great <WH7235> experience <WH7200> of wisdom <WH2451> and knowledge. <WH1847>

And I gave <WH5414> my heart <WH3820> to know <WH3045> wisdom, <WH2451> and to know <WH3045> madness <WH1947> and folly: <WH5531> I perceived <WH3045> that this <WH2088> also <WH1571> is vexation <WH7475> of spirit. <WH7307>
For in much <WH7230> wisdom <WH2451> is much <WH7230> grief: <WH3708> and he that increases <WH3254> knowledge <WH1847> increases <WH3254> sorrow. <WH4341>
